# Metadata for document properties (not rendered as title page)
title: ""
title-meta: "Working Paper Title"
author-meta: "Your Name"

# Citation metadata for citeable articles
# See: https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/create-citeable-articles.html
citation:
  title: "Working Paper Title"
  author:
    - name: Your Name
      orcid: 0000-0000-0000-0000
      affiliation: "College of Information Science, University of Arizona"
  type: article
  container-title: "InfoSci Working Paper Series"
  issued: 2025
  url: https://example.com/working-paper

format:
  typst:
    papersize: us-letter
    margin:
      top: 1in
      bottom: 1in
      left: 1.25in
      right: 1.25in
    fontsize: 11pt
    mainfont: "Times New Roman"
    number-sections: true
bibliography: references.bib
csl: assets/apa.csl
reference-section-title: References
---

```{=typst}
// UA Brand Colors
#let ua-blue = rgb("#0C234B")
#let ua-red = rgb("#AB0520")
#let ua-cool-gray = rgb("#E2E9EB")

// Working Paper Header
#set page(margin: (top: 1in, bottom: 1in, left: 1.25in, right: 1.25in))

#grid(
  columns: (1fr, auto),
  align: (left + top, right + top),
  [#image("assets/infosci-logo.png", width: 2.5in)],
  [
    #text(size: 10pt, fill: ua-blue)[
      *InfoSci Working Paper Series* \
      WP-#datetime.today().display("[year]")-XXX
    ]
  ]
)

#v(0.3in)
#line(length: 100%, stroke: 1pt + ua-blue)
#v(0.4in)

// Title
#align(center)[
  #text(size: 20pt, weight: "bold", fill: ua-blue)[
    Working Paper Title
  ]

  #v(0.15in)

  #text(size: 14pt, style: "italic")[
    A Descriptive Subtitle
  ]
]

#v(0.3in)

// Author Block
#align(center)[
  #text(size: 12pt)[
    *Your Name* \
    #text(size: 10pt)[
      College of Information Science \
      University of Arizona \
      youremail\@arizona.edu \
      ORCID: 0000-0000-0000-0000
    ]
  ]
]

#v(0.2in)

#align(center)[
  #text(size: 10pt)[
    #datetime.today().display("[month repr:long] [year]")
  ]
]

#v(0.3in)

// Abstract Box
#rect(
  width: 100%,
  fill: ua-cool-gray,
  inset: 1em,
  radius: 4pt,
  [
    #text(weight: "bold", size: 11pt)[Abstract]

    #v(0.1in)

    #text(size: 10pt)[
      This is the abstract for the working paper. It should provide a concise summary of the research question, methodology, key findings, and implications. The abstract typically ranges from 150-250 words and should enable readers to quickly assess the relevance and contribution of the paper.
    ]

    #v(0.15in)

    #text(size: 10pt)[
      *Keywords:* keyword one, keyword two, keyword three
    ]
  ]
)

#v(0.3in)
#line(length: 100%, stroke: 0.5pt + ua-blue)
#v(0.3in)

// Heading styles
#show heading.where(level: 1): it => {
  v(0.25in)
  text(size: 14pt, weight: "bold", fill: ua-blue)[#it.body]
  v(0.1in)
}

#show heading.where(level: 2): it => {
  v(0.2in)
  text(size: 12pt, weight: "bold", fill: ua-blue)[#it.body]
  v(0.08in)
}

#show heading.where(level: 3): it => {
  v(0.15in)
  text(size: 11pt, weight: "bold")[#it.body]
  v(0.05in)
}
```

# Introduction

[Introduce the research problem, its significance, and the gap in existing knowledge that this paper addresses. Conclude with a clear statement of the paper's purpose and research questions or hypotheses.]

# Literature Review

[Review relevant prior research, theoretical frameworks, and empirical findings. Identify the theoretical foundation for your work and position your contribution within the existing literature.]

## Theoretical Framework

[Describe the theoretical lens or framework guiding your research.]

## Prior Research

[Synthesize relevant empirical studies and identify gaps.]

# Methodology

[Describe your research design, data collection procedures, sample or participants, and analytical approach. Provide sufficient detail for replication.]

## Research Design

[Describe the overall approach (qualitative, quantitative, mixed methods).]

## Data Collection

[Detail your data sources and collection procedures.]

## Analysis

[Explain your analytical methods and any tools used.]

# Findings

[Present your results clearly and systematically. Use appropriate tables, figures, or visualizations to support your narrative.]

## Finding One

[Present first major finding with supporting evidence.]

## Finding Two

[Present second major finding with supporting evidence.]

# Discussion

[Interpret your findings in relation to your research questions and the existing literature. Discuss theoretical and practical implications.]

## Implications for Theory

[Discuss contributions to theoretical understanding.]

## Implications for Practice

[Discuss practical applications and recommendations.]

## Limitations

[Acknowledge limitations of the study and their potential impact on findings.]

# Conclusion

[Summarize the main contributions, key findings, and directions for future research.]

# References {.unnumbered}

::: {#refs}
:::

#v(0.5in)
#line(length: 100%, stroke: 0.5pt + ua-blue)
#v(0.1in)
#text(size: 9pt, style: "italic")[
  *Disclaimer:* This is a working paper and represents work in progress. Please do not cite without permission from the author(s). Comments and suggestions are welcome.
]
